project.name: FINCH
project.full_name: Field Imaging Nanosatellite for Crop Residue Hyperspectral Mapping

mission_overview.description: FINCH is a 3U CubeSat mission designed to conduct a technological demonstration of crop residue mapping from Low Earth Orbit using hyperspectral short-wave infrared remote sensing.

mission_phase.current: Detailed design phase with rapid prototyping and proofs-of-concept

design_focus: Integration of high-performance components across all subsystems

primary_goals: Technological demonstration of the first Volume Phase Holographic (VPH) grism in a small form-factor
Proof of concept for crop residue mapping using hyperspectral short-wave infrared (SWIR) satellite remote sensing

systems.role: Coordinates design decisions and interfaces across the FINCH satellite using systems engineering principles.

science.role: Ensures scientific validity and value of the mission through modeling, analysis, and validation.

mission_operations.role: Defines how FINCH operates in space and manages mission risks.
responsibilities: Collaboration with firmware, power, RF, electronics, and ADCS teams

data_processing.role: Processes downlinked satellite data to improve quality and usability.

hardware.role: Designs and tests the electronic hardware that powers FINCH.

firmware_and_cdh.role: Develops low-level software to control satellite subsystems.

rf.role: Enables communication between FINCH and ground stations.
